abstract: Johnson & Johnson has found merger-size savings — in itself. The health care giant will eliminate about 8,000 jobs. But the benefits are likely to be as fleeting as the cuts accompanying most giant pharmaceutical mergers, Breakingviews says.
snippet: Johnson & Johnson has found merger-size savings — in itself. The health care giant will eliminate about 8,000 jobs. But the benefits are likely to be as fleeting as the cuts accompanying most giant pharmaceutical mergers, Breakingviews says.
lead_paragraph: Johnson & Johnson has found merger-size savings — in itself. The health care giant will eliminate about 8,000 jobs. But the benefits are likely to be as fleeting as the cuts accompanying most giant pharmaceutical mergers, Breakingviews says. That is because it is increasingly tough to find new drugs to replace lost revenue as sales of old products run down.
